definition: to hand in/to hand over/to seize

sentences.english: A roll of supermarket-style stickers was also confiscated.
sentences.chinese: 同时被缴获的还有一卷超市样式的不干胶标签。
马来西亚海关缴获695根象牙。

sentences.english: The military equipment captured was beyond counting.
sentences.chinese: 缴获的武器装备不可胜数。

sentences.english: We confiscated all the drugs from this smuggler gang.
sentences.chinese: 我们缴获了这伙私枭的全部毒品。

sentences.english: At this time, the Wuchang holding a submachinegun seized from the devil body joined the battle.
sentences.chinese: 此时，那五常抱着从鬼子身上缴获的冲锋枪加入战斗。

sentences.english: Mounted Apachean troops riding captured horse, wielding bows and hatchets .
sentences.chinese: 阿帕奇弓骑兵骑乘缴获战马，使用战弓和短斧作战。

sentences.english: He unlocked secrets of the Force from a captured Jedi Holocron.
sentences.chinese: 他从一个缴获的绝地全息记录仪中发现了原力的秘密。

sentences.english: The provisions were obtained mainly from the war, the land owners, or by purchase or credit on the way.
sentences.chinese: 给养来源主要有战争缴获，打土豪筹粮款和购买借贷。

sentences.english: The agents carried guns and confiscated plenty of weapons and explosives.
sentences.chinese: 特工们执枪行动，缴获了大量武器和爆炸品。

sentences.english: The Red Army gave to the villagers part of the salt that they had seized in battles.
sentences.chinese: 红军在战斗中缴获的食盐，都要分一部分给群众。

sentences.english: The anti-drug sweep had netted nearly 900 kilogrammes of cocaine.
sentences.chinese: 扫毒行动已缴获了近900千克的可卡因。

sentences.english: They captured fifty enemy soldiers and many weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们俘虏了五十个敌兵，缴获了大量的武器装备。

sentences.english: We have already seized 10 to 15 of the army's tanks and a large number of Kalashnikovs," he said.
sentences.chinese: 我们已缴获了10到15辆政府军坦克和大量冲锋枪。

sentences.english: Beijing has seized more than 41000 pieces of pirated audio-video materials in the past four months.
sentences.chinese: 北京在过去的4个月缴获盗版音像制品四万一千多件。

definition: to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
to detain/to hold in custody/to distrain/to seize property
